ITEMS: Given unprecedented access to soldiers and terrorists alike, journalist Michael Ware presents an epic, uncensored, intimate account of the Iraq War.
After 20 years on Death Row, self-educated inmate Nick petitions the court to be executed, then tells his twisting, turning tale of despair and hope.
Professor Dan Ariely examines the truth behind lying: why we do it, when we do it and how society suffers from whoppers and little white lies alike.
The Last Man on the Moon
Astronaut Gene Cernan looks back on the exciting history of NASA's lunar landings and how being the last man to stand on the moon changed his life.
Ali Wong's stand up special delves into her sexual adventures, hoarding, the rocky road to pregnancy, and why feminism is terrible.
An inspiring look at the brilliant, outrageous women who spearheaded the 1960s women's movement resonates with those who still face gender inequality.
Expert winemakers and sommeliers delve into the mysteries surrounding wine, from its delicious and colorful history to how it's made and marketed.
Iconic intellectual Noam Chomsky states his case for how the bulk of America's wealth and influence has been transferred to the hands of a few.
With never-before seen home video, this film recounts the paranoid downward spiral of John E. du Pont and the murder of Olympic wrestler Dave Schultz.
The 50-year history of rock climbing in Yosemite Valley is chronicled in this documentary charting the birth and rise of a rebellious counterculture.
Before achieving mainstream success in the 1980s, glam rock icons Twisted Sister spent years crafting their outrageous act in the New York club scene.
A documentarian uses his own family's experiences as a springboard to explore the ethical issues surrounding the FDA and pharmaceutical industry.
Frei:Gespielt - Mehmet Scholl: Über das Spiel hinaus
This documentary profiles top Bundesliga soccer player Mehmet Scholl and recalls his career achievements as he prepares to retire.
After he's released from a mental hospital, a gifted German mathematician partners with a Ukrainian boy to build a forest cabin where they'll live.
Fidel Castro and guerrilla rebel Ernesto 'Che' Guevara land in Cuba with plans to overthrow dictator Fulgencio Batista and launch a revolution.
Paris police redouble their efforts against gangster and publicity-hungry celebrity Jacques Mesrine by forming a unit dedicated to stopping him.
After an incident in the army gives him his first taste of violent power, a notorious French gangster launches headlong into a harrowing career.
Paula, a mother of two, enters into an affair with a married man named Paul, trying desperately to get him to lose his uptight, conservative ways.
This unfiltered documentary follows the rocky life and stratospheric career of Allen Iverson, an NBA icon who left an indelible mark on the sport.
This documentary tracks a day in the life of the desert creatures of the American Southwest, with footage of animals competing for food and survival.
Examine the legacy and career of Daft Punk, the enigmatic EDM duo whose work has crossed over to the mainstream despite their secretive persona.
A riveting look into the murky reaches of cyberspace sheds light on the arrest and trial of the alleged creator of Silk Road, an online black market.
The story of Jesus Christ's final hours, from Last Supper to resurrection, unfolds in the streets of a modern New Orleans in this live musical event.
After suffering a stroke at age 34, a woman documents her struggles, setbacks and eventual breakthrough as she relearns to speak, read and write.
British comedian Jimmy Carr unleashes his deadpan delivery and wickedly funny one-liners to a sold-out audience at the UK's Hammersmith Apollo.
Sent to investigate a rash of shipwrecks, Ned encounters the nefarious Capt. Nemo's submarine in this adaptation of the classic Jules Verne adventure.
A Spanish girl in Berlin falls in with four young men. When her new friends run afoul of a gangster, she gets caught up in their problems.
As chef Curtis Duffy oversees every aspect of opening his own restaurant, Grace, he recalls his turbulent childhood and difficult adult relationships.
Elser - Er hätte die Welt verändert
Officials interrogate German worker Georg Elser when a bomb he plants detonates after Hitler has left a rally, thwarting his assassination attempt.
A look at the life of karate master Fumio Demura shows how he spread the discipline in the West, winning countless devotees and influencing Hollywood.
The Lost Honour of Christopher Jefferies
When a young woman is murdered, the media hound and vilify a retired schoolteacher, whose only crimes are his odd appearance and overbearing manners.
With his 30th birthday just around the corner, an Indian-American man enlists his family to help him find the perfect wife.
The bearded, bawdy and comically bitter Tom Segura gets real about body piercings, the 'Area 51' of men's bodies, and the lie he told Mike Tyson.
The bookish young Belle ventures into the castle of a mysterious beast, and with the help of his staff, learns that true beauty shines from the heart.
In the Disney adaptation of the classic story, the Robinson family is marooned on an island inhabited only by an impressive array of wildlife.
Self-absorbed, headstrong Southern Belle Scarlett O'Hara meets her match in Rhett Butler just as the Civil War breaks out.
Two robbers take a man and his kids hostage. Racing to the Mexican border, the criminals rendezvous at a cantina -- not knowing it is a vampire den.
Authentic locales and rousing action set the stage as Robert Louis Stevenson's adventure yarn of buccaneers and buried gold is brought to life.
This harrowing documentary profiles parents who lose sight of what's important as they relentlessly push their kids to excel at sports.
In the 1970s, a group of activists who gathered to protest nuclear testing formed the iconic Greenpeace environmental organization.
Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
America's most beloved ventriloquist hits the road, bringing along all of his most popular pals, including Achmed, Peanut and Walter.
When Val Kilmer tantalizes him with a new film role, Warwick hustles to raise capital to finance the project. But is the offer too good to be true?
After Zimbabwe's disputed 2008 election results, political enemies are asked to write a new constitution and save their country from a bleak future.
This exposé tackles the disturbing epidemic of sexual assault on college campuses and school officials' efforts to cover up the crimes.
A defiant warrior-monk arrives at Kublai Khan's court in chains and soon earns his tragic nickname in this 30-minute origin story.
Embarking on a 700-mile, round-island motorcycle trip, a group of ailing Taiwanese seniors ignores their families' concerns and hits the open road.
A matinee idol hoping to survive as Hollywood shifts from silent films to talkies finds himself torn between his co-star girlfriend and a chorus girl.
While he's being bullied at school, a Nova Scotia boy worries about his mother's money woes, until an enigmatic sea captain shows up to assist them.
Physics professor Fanis rediscovers the lesson his spice-merchant grandfather once taught him: Life, like food, is best enjoyed with a little zest.
To teach his younger brother about fidelity, an Aboriginal elder tells an ancestral fable about a warrior sibling's battle for his bride's affection.
A Jewish couple and their daughter emigrate from Germany to Kenya to escape the Nazis and are forced to adapt to life on an unfamiliar continent.
Combining live action and animation, this Disney adventure concerns an eccentric witch and the children she's protecting in World War II.
Love comes to a lonely writer in the sleekest of packages when he finds himself falling for the advanced operating system he bought to run his life.
My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Friendship Games
Rainbow Dash, Applejack and friends compete against Crystal Prep Academy and their lead athlete, this world's Twilight Sparkle, in sporting events.
This documentary recounts a 1994 incident in Honolulu in which a circus elephant attacked and killed its trainer, then ran loose on the city streets.
The long, bitter rivalry between politically opposed intellectuals Gore Vidal and William F. Buckley Jr. is recounted in this acclaimed documentary.
In this retelling of the classic fairy tale, feisty Cinderella endures hassles by her stepfamily but gains the upper hand on the bachelor prince.
The Story of Little Mook: Tales from Europe
All the children in town mock the local hunchback, Mook, until the day he amazes them with his thrilling life story in this family adventure.
This Oscar-winning epic tells the true story of T.E. Lawrence, who helped unite warring Arab tribes to strike back against the Turks in World War I.
Armed with boyish charm and a sharp wit, the former 'SNL' writer offers sly takes on marriage, his beef with babies and the time he met Bill Clinton.
This film chronicles the varied career of bombastic comic and social critic Barry Crimmins and the painful past that inspired his peaceful activism.
William Shatner writes and directs this documentary that tells the true, behind-the-scenes story of the creation of 'Star Trek: The Next Generation.'
In this taut thriller, a TV reporter and a cameraman covering a routine story at a nuclear plant observe --- and covertly film -- a near-meltdown.
Jack lives in a mythical forest until fate leads him to battle a devil to rescue a unicorn. If he loses, the world plunges into eternal darkness.
The story of mystic Paramahansa Yogananda illuminates his key role in bringing yoga and meditation to the modern Western world, inspiring millions.
This documentary chronicles the true story of a French fashion student who discovered via the Internet an identical twin she never knew existed.
An insightful portrait of quirky genius Dean Kamen sheds light on his latest invention, which could potentially solve the world's water problems.
This documentary chronicles the life story of the Dallas Mavericks' Dirk Nowitzki and his inspiring journey from Germany to superstardom in the NBA.
Once Upon a Time in America
Director Sergio Leone's sprawling crime epic follows a group of Jewish mobsters who rise in the ranks of organized crime in 1920s New York City.
A Miami detective imbued with ninja superpowers travels back in time to kill Adolf Hitler and the Nazis in an arcade game-style war.
When civil war tears his family apart, a young West African boy is forced to join a unit of mercenary fighters and transform into a child soldier.
There's no subject too dark as the comedian skewers taboos and riffs on national tragedies before pulling back the curtain on his provocative style.
Over 93 days in Ukraine, what started as peaceful student demonstrations became a violent revolution and full-fledged civil rights movement.
Akko's unconventional ideas don't go over well at the Magical Academy, but when a dragon is unleashed, she may be the only witch who can save the day.
Little Witch Academia: The Enchanted Parade
When Akko and other troubled students at Luna Nova are assigned to manage the annual witch hunt parade, Akko wants to make the event more positive.
Tell Spring Not to Come This Year
Follow the lives of two Afghan National Army soldiers as they continue the fight against the Taliban in the wake of NATO troops' departure in 2014.
After crash-landing on a desolate planet, a pilot and her passengers, one of whom is a convicted killer, must fend off a race of carnivorous aliens.
When an insatiable great white shark terrorizes Amity Island, a police chief, an oceanographer and a grizzled shark hunter seek to destroy the beast.
Albert Maysles focuses on a fashion legend, who at 93 is still at the top of her game, choosing dresses, advising models and haggling with buyers.
In a documentary with unparalleled access, discover the people and sounds that inspired rock 'n' roll legend Keith Richards from childhood to today.
A war correspondent and photographer join two veterans on a journey into the post-combat lives of other men and women who survived recent conflicts.
In 1970s New York City, an unlikely band of young residents helped bring peace to the gang-ruled streets by ushering in a new culture: hip-hop.
Learn how factory farming is decimating the planet's natural resources -- and why this crisis has been largely ignored by major environmental groups.
Dreamy delivery girl Ramona captures Scott Pilgrim's heart, but he must vanquish all seven of her evil exes in martial arts battles to win her love.
When a Texas professor and advocate for the elimination of the death penalty is falsely accused of a crime, he ends up on death row himself.
It's Kind of a Funny Story
Teenager Craig checks himself into a mental health clinic,  but when the youth ward is unexpectedly closed, he must live among the adult patients.
Tensions run high when a crazed bomber rigs a Los Angeles bus with a device that will kill everyone on board if the vehicle's speed dips below 50 mph.
Retired gunslinger William Munny reluctantly takes one last job -- and even more reluctantly accepts a boastful young man as a partner.
This Oscar-winning drama charts the life and work of famed economist John Forbes Nash Jr., a brilliant man plagued by the anguish of mental illness.
The list of actors cast as Starfleet commanders remains short. William Shatner interviews a raft of other 'captains' in this affable documentary.
When an ex-cop and her ex-con husband learn they can't have children, they kidnap one of a furniture magnate's quintuplet sons.
Robert Altman's thinly veiled satire concerns a group of Army doctors fighting military insanity and healing wounded soldiers during the Korean War.
This classic morality tale stars Marlon Brando as a has-been boxer who experiences a crisis of conscience while working for a mobbed-up union boss.
Sent to cover the annual ritual of groundhog Punxsutawney Phil, a self-centered TV weatherman mysteriously begins living the same day again and again.
The Bridge on the River Kwai
This sweeping epic is set in a World War II Japanese prison camp, where British prisoners are forced to build a bridge as a morale-building exercise.
Close Encounters of the Third Kind
As inexplicable events baffle experts worldwide, a UFO-obsessed man is drawn to a mysterious mountain that leads to a life-changing encounter.
More than 40 years after a band of activists raided an FBI office to find evidence of illegal surveillance, those responsible discuss the incident.
Atticus Finch defends an innocent black man against rape charges but ends up in a maelstrom of hate and prejudice.
This film takes a timely and hard-hitting look at how the food we eat is helping or hurting our health, and what we can do to live (and eat) better.
After rising from humble beginnings to world fame, pro skateboarder Chris Cole returns to his hometown to give kids the chance that he never had.
